DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: FERNANDES, F. W.;FERNANDES, FLAVIANO W.;FERNANDES, F.W.;FERNANDES, FLAVIANO WILLIAMS

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: O autor possui Mestrado e Doutorado em Ciências pelo Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica obtendo experiência com dinâmica molecular e cálculos primeiros princípios no estudo de interfaces sólido-líquido. Atualmente, o autor é Professor do Instituto Federal do Paraná onde desenvolve trabalhos relacionados com materiais nanoestruturados através de métodos de modelagem molecular, como mecânica molecular, teoria de funcional de densidade e Tight-Binding.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: The author is a Doctor in Science by the Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica. He has experience with techniques in Atomic Molecular Physics and condensed matter such as Ab Initio, Tight-Binding and Molecular Dynamics methods. Nowadays, the author has working at the Instituto Federal do Paraná.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Coulomb excitation in high-energy heavy-ion collisons is often calculated&#10;using straight-line trajectories in a semiclassical approximation.&#10;Such an approximation is certainly good at relativistic energies,&#10;above about 1GeV/nucleon, but becomes dubious at lower energies, especially&#10;for heavy systems such as Pb + Pb. We perform calculations&#10;of semiclassical Coulomb excitation including the Coulomb and nuclear&#10;deflections of the trajectory. We compare our results with calculations&#10;using the straight-line trajectory that passes through the point of&#10;closest approach. We find that the Coulomb deflection in the system&#10;Pb + Pb reduces the excitation of the giant dipole&#10;resonance by about 30% at 100Mev/nucleon, but that the trajectory&#10;effects diminish rapidly with increasing energy.
